subclassFluff.name: Runesmith
entries: {@i Inscribe Ancient Power Through Mystical Runes}

entries.name: Design Note: Runesmith Origin
entries: The Runesmith is an Artificer subclass that channels magic through ancient runic inscriptions. Unlike the explosive Artillerist, the Runesmith focuses on protective and empowering runes:

items.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: grants proficiency with Calligrapher's Supplies and allows faster crafting of magic scrolls.

items.name: Runic Sigil
entries: creates a magical construct inscribed with protective or offensive runes that can shield allies, empower attacks, or ward against enemies.

items.name: Explosive Rune
entries: allows your sigils to detonate with runic power and increases their effectiveness.

classFeature.name: Runesmith
entries: A Runesmith specializes in inscribing ancient runes to protect allies, empower weapons, and ward against threats.

classFeature.name: Runesmith Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the {@table Runesmith Spells|FFTRunesmith} table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

classFeature.name: Runic Sigil
entries: Using {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} or {@item Mason's Tools|XPHB}, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to create a Small or Tiny {@object Runic Sigil|FFTRunesmith} in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of yourself. The sigil's game statistics appear below. You determine its appearance, which can be a floating rune, carved stone, or inscribed tablet. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 Hit Points or after 1 hour. You can dismiss it early as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.

Once you create a sigil, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or expend a spell slot to create one. You can have only one sigil at a time and can't create one while your sigil is present.

classFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice.
In addition, when you craft a magic {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG}, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

classFeature.name: Runic Empowerment
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can use {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} to inscribe special runes onto a weapon, {@item Rod|XPHB}, {@item Staff|XPHB}, or {@item Wand|XPHB} and thereby turn it into your runic focus. The runes disappear from the object if you later inscribe them on a different item. The runes otherwise last indefinitely.

You can use your runic focus as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Artificer spells. When you cast an Artificer spell through the runic focus, roll {@damage 1d8}, and you gain a bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls equal to the number rolled.

Additionally, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to inscribe a temporary rune of power on their weapon, granting them a {@dice 1d8} bonus to the attack roll. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Explosive Rune
entries: Every {@object Runic Sigil|FFTRunesmith} you create is now more powerful. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Detonate
entries: When your sigil is reduced to 0 Hit Points, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to command the sigil to detonate if you are within 60 feet of it. Doing so destroys the sigil and forces each creature within 20 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave}, taking {@damage 3d10} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Empowered Runes
entries: The sigil's damage and healing rolls increase by {@damage 1d8}.

classFeature.name: Master Runesmith
entries: You're a master at inscribing protective wards using your {@object Runic Sigil|FFTRunesmith}. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Dual Inscriptions
entries: You can now have two sigils at the same time. You can create two with the same {@action Magic|XPHB} action (but not with the same spell slot), and you can activate both of them with the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, ordering them to use the same activation option or different ones. You can't create a third sigil while you have two.

items.name: Runic Aegis
entries: You and your allies have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} while within 10 feet of your {@object Runic Sigil|FFTRunesmith}.

entries: {@note Created by the {@subclassFeature Runic Sigil|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|Runesmith|FFTRunesmith|3} subclass feature.}

actionEntries.name: Activate Sigil (Requires You to be within 60 Feet of the Sigil)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you order the sigil to use the Rune of Warding, Rune of Smiting, or Rune of Restoration option below; you can direct the sigil to move up to 15 feet before or after that option:

items.name: Rune of Warding
entries: The sigil creates a protective barrier in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Each creature of your choice in that area gains {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the next instance of damage they take before the start of your next turn. Additionally, hostile creatures in the {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} must make a Wisdom saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave} or have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on their next attack roll.

items.name: Rune of Smiting
entries: Make a ranged spell attack originating from the sigil at one creature or object within 120 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Force damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave} or be knocked {@condition prone|XPHB}.

items.name: Rune of Restoration
entries: The sigil emits healing runic energy that grants itself and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of it a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). Additionally, one creature of your choice within range can immediately end one condition on itself chosen from {@condition charmed|XPHB}, {@condition frightened|XPHB}, or {@condition poisoned|XPHB}.
